title: Developer Guide: Lightning Login (LNURL-auth)
summary: Lightning Login is a passwordless authentication protocol based on signed challenge–response using wallet-derived keys. This guide explains the protocol, implementation patterns, security considerations, and production best practices.

sections.title: The Identity Problem
sections.description: Traditional authentication methods centralize control and expose users to risk.
items: Email-based accounts rely on corporate gatekeepers
OAuth identity flows leak metadata to identity providers

sections.title: Why LNURL-auth?
sections.description: LNURL-auth introduces a global, pseudonymous, user-controlled identity primitive.
items: Users authenticate using Bitcoin wallet keys
Keypairs are derived per-domain — no cross-site linkability
No emails, usernames, or personal data required
Servers never store secrets capable of authentication
The flow is simple: scan → sign → authenticate

sections.title: What Developers Get
sections.description: LNURL-auth simplifies backend logic and improves security dramatically.
items: Clean integration with modern app architectures
